alert.note: Alert for Brunswick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Brunswick County through 1130 PM EDT... At 1059 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lawrenceville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Lawrenceville and Alberta around 1110 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Cochran, Callaville, Edgerton, Dolphin, Warfield, Meredithville and Prices Mill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for south central and southeastern Virginia.
